sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: BRODSKY & SMITH SHAREHOLDER UPDATE: Notifying Investors of the Following Investigations: Clearwater Analytics Holdings, Inc. (NYSE - CWAN), Katapult Holdings, Inc. (Nasdaq - KPLT), Janus Henderson Group plc (NYSE - JHG), Amicus Therapeutics,
feed.summary: Brodsky & Smith is investigating potential breaches of fiduciary duties by the Boards of Directors of Clearwater Analytics Holdings, Inc. (CWAN), Katapult Holdings, Inc. (KPLT), Janus Henderson Group plc (JHG), and Amicus Therapeutics, Inc. (FOLD). These investigations concern whether the proposed acquisition prices for these companies provide fair value to shareholders. Shareholders are encouraged to contact Brodsky & Smith for discussions regarding these investigations.

feed.title: BRODSKY & SMITH SHAREHOLDER UPDATE: Notifying Investors of the Following Investigations: Clearwater Analytics Holdings, Inc. (NYSE - CWAN), Katapult Holdings, Inc. (Nasdaq - KPLT), Janus Henderson Group plc (NYSE - JHG), Amicus Therapeutics, Inc. (Nasdaq - FOLD)
feed.summary: Brodsky & Smith is notifying investors about investigations into several companies due to proposed acquisitions, focusing on whether shareholder fiduciary duties were breached and if the deal considerations provide fair value. The firms under investigation include Clearwater Analytics Holdings (NYSE - CWAN), Katapult Holdings (Nasdaq - KPLT), Janus Henderson Group plc (NYSE - JHG), and Amicus Therapeutics, Inc. (Nasdaq - FOLD). Shareholders are encouraged to contact Brodsky & Smith for discussions regarding these investigations.

feed.title: Halper Sadeh LLC Encourages KPLT, FOLD, DHIL Shareholders to Contact the Firm to Discuss Their Rights
feed.summary: Halper Sadeh LLC, an investor rights law firm, is encouraging shareholders of Katapult Holdings, Inc. (KPLT), Amicus Therapeutics, Inc. (FOLD), and Diamond Hill Investment Group, Inc. (DHIL) to contact them regarding potential violations of federal securities laws and/or breaches of fiduciary duties. The firm is investigating KPLT's merger with The Aaron's Company, FOLD's sale to BioMarin Pharmaceutical for $14.50 per share, and DHIL's sale to First Eagle Investments for $175.00 per share. Halper Sadeh LLC aims to secure increased consideration, additional disclosures, or other benefits for shareholders on a contingent fee basis.

feed.title: $HAREHOLDER ALERT: The M&A Class Action Firm Announces An Investigation of Katapult Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ: KPLT)
feed.summary: Monteverde & Associates PC has initiated an investigation into Katapult Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ: KPLT) concerning its merger with The Aaron's Company, Inc. and CCF Holdings LLC. The firm, a national class action securities firm, is assessing whether the deal is fair to shareholders. Shareholders of Katapult Holdings are encouraged to contact Juan Monteverde for a free consultation regarding their rights.

feed.title: $HAREHOLDER ALERT: The M&A Class Action Firm Announces An Investigation of Katapult Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ: KPLT)
feed.summary: Monteverde & Associates PC, a class action firm, has announced an investigation into Katapult Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ: KPLT) concerning its merger with The Aaron's Company, Inc. and CCF Holdings LLC. The firm, headquartered in New York City, encourages shareholders who have concerns about the fairness of the deal to contact them for a free consultation. Monteverde & Associates PC has a track record of recovering money for shareholders in class action securities cases.

feed.title: Shareholder Alert: The Ademi Firm investigates whether Katapult Holdings Inc. is obtaining a Fair Price for its Public Shareholders
feed.summary: The Ademi Firm is investigating Katapult (Nasdaq: KPLT) regarding potential breaches of fiduciary duty related to its transaction with The Aaron's Company Inc. and CCF Holdings LLC. This investigation focuses on whether Katapult shareholders are receiving a fair price, as they will own only 6% of the combined company, and the implications of a significant penalty for accepting competing bids. The firm is examining the conduct of Katapult's board of directors to ensure they are fulfilling their duties to all shareholders.

feed.title: Shareholder Alert: The Ademi Firm investigates whether Katapult Holdings Inc. is obtaining a Fair Price for its Public Shareholders
feed.summary: The Ademi Firm is investigating Katapult Holdings Inc. (Nasdaq: KPLT) for potential breaches of fiduciary duty regarding its transaction with The Aaron's Company Inc. and CCF Holdings LLC. The investigation focuses on whether Katapult shareholders are receiving a fair price, as they will own only 6% of the combined company, and on the impact of a significant penalty clause limiting competing transactions. Shareholders are invited to join the investigation to assess the conduct of Katapult's board of directors.

feed.title: Katapult Stock Jumps After Aaron's And CCF Agree To All Stock Merger
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ: KPLT) stock surged after announcing an all-stock merger with The Aaron’s Company Inc. and CCF Holdings LLC. This deal aims to broaden access to retail goods and financial services for non-prime consumers by combining Katapult’s digital platform with Aaron’s retail footprint and CCF’s credit operations. The combined entity is projected to generate over $4 billion in trailing revenue and approximately $450 million in adjusted EBITDA.

feed.title: Katapult stock jumps over 30% after merger agreement with Aaron’s and CCF – why this combination makes sense
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings Inc. (KPLT) shares surged over 30% following an announcement of a strategic business combination with Aaron's LLC and Conductor Commerce Inc. (CCF). This merger aims to significantly expand Katapult's reach in the lease-to-own sector by integrating its e-commerce focused services with Aaron’s extensive retail footprint and CCF's technology. The new entity, named Conductor Commerce, is expected to generate over $3 billion in revenue and serve nearly 3 million active customers.

feed.title: KPLT Stock Alert: Halper Sadeh LLC is Investigating Whether the Merger of Katapult Holdings, Inc. is Fair to Shareholders
feed.summary: Halper Sadeh LLC, an investor rights law firm, is investigating whether the merger of Katapult Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ: KPLT) with The Aaron’s Company, Inc. and CCF Holdings LLC is fair to Katapult shareholders. The firm is examining if Katapult's board violated securities laws or breached fiduciary duties by not securing the best consideration or disclosing all material information. Halper Sadeh LLC encourages affected shareholders to contact them to discuss their legal rights and options.

feed.title: Katapult Projects Strong Financial Growth Amid Economic Headwinds
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings Inc. (KPLT) has seen its stock rise by 7.82% after releasing an optimistic earnings report, expecting an 18-23% revenue increase for 2025. Despite operational inefficiencies and a leveraged balance sheet, the company shows strong EBITDA margins and improved EPS, indicating resilience and strategic growth. However, financial vulnerabilities suggest a tempered outlook for investors due to cash flow concerns and debt.

feed.title: Katapult Holdings (KPLT) Stock Surges on Aaron's–CCF All-Stock Deal: Latest News, Forecasts, and Analyst Views (Dec. 12, 2025)
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings (KPLT) announced an all-stock combination with The Aaron’s Company, Inc. and CCF Holdings LLC, aiming to create a scaled omni-channel platform serving non-prime consumers. This transformational deal, expected to close in the first half of 2026, significantly reshapes KPLT, with current Katapult stockholders owning 6% of the combined entity. The market reacted positively, causing KPLT stock to surge in pre-market trading, as the merger promises to integrate Katapult's technology with Aaron's retail reach and CCF's financial services.

feed.title: Shareholder Alert: The Ademi Firm investigates whether Katapult Holdings Inc. is obtaining a Fair Price for its Public Shareholders
feed.summary: The Ademi Firm is investigating Katapult Holdings Inc. (Nasdaq: KPLT) regarding its recent transaction with The Aaron's Company Inc. and CCF Holdings LLC. The investigation aims to determine if Katapult shareholders are receiving a fair price, given they will own only 6% of the combined company, and whether the board of directors fulfilled its fiduciary duties, particularly concerning a significant penalty for accepting competing offers.

feed.title: Form 425 Katapult Holdings, Inc. Filed by: Katapult Holdings, Inc.
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings, Inc. filed a Form 425 regarding an all-stock merger transaction involving Katapult, Aaron’s, and CCF Holdings. The document includes forward-looking statements about the merger’s expected benefits, future opportunities, and operations, while also outlining associated risks and uncertainties. Katapult plans to announce a special meeting for stockholder approval and will file a Form S-4 registration statement, urging investors to review these important documents.

feed.title: Shareholder Alert: The Ademi Firm investigates whether Katapult Holdings Inc. is obtaining a Fair Price for its Public Shareholders
feed.summary: The Ademi Firm is investigating Katapult Holdings Inc. (Nasdaq: KPLT) regarding potential breaches of fiduciary duty related to its transaction with The Aaron's Company Inc. and CCF Holdings LLC. The investigation focuses on whether Katapult shareholders are receiving a fair price, given they will own only 6% of the combined company, and concerns about potential benefits to Katapult insiders and limitations on competing bids. Shareholders are encouraged to join the investigation.

feed.title: Katapult, The Aaron’s Company, and CCF Holdings To Merge
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings, The Aaron's Company, and CCF Holdings have announced an all-stock merger to create a premier omnichannel platform serving non-prime consumers. This transaction aims to combine Katapult's technology with Aaron's retail presence and CCF Holdings' customer base, offering a comprehensive suite of financial solutions and durable goods. The combined company, to be named Katapult Holdings, Inc., is expected to have over $4 billion in pro forma LTM revenue and approximately $450 million in pro forma LTM Adjusted EBITDA, with the transaction expected to close in the first half of 2026.

feed.title: Katapult, The Aaron’s Company, and CCF Holdings to Combine in All-Stock Transaction
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings, Inc. announced a definitive agreement to combine with The Aaron’s Company, Inc. and CCF Holdings LLC in an all-stock transaction. This merger aims to create a comprehensive financial solutions and omni-channel retail platform for non-prime consumers, leveraging the strengths of all three companies. The combined entity is expected to have greater scale, improved operating leverage, and a stronger balance sheet, positioning it for accelerated growth and an expanded suite of financial solutions.

feed.title: (KPLT) as a Liquidity Pulse for Institutional Tactics
feed.summary: This article provides an in-depth AI-generated analysis of Katapult Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ: KPLT), focusing on its liquidity pulse for institutional tactics. It outlines specific trading strategies (Position, Momentum Breakout, Risk Hedging) with entry zones, targets, and stop losses. The analysis also includes multi-timeframe signal analysis, highlighting support and resistance levels for near-term, mid-term, and long-term horizons, and notes weak near-term sentiment but positive overall sentiment.

feed.title: Gregory L. Zink Joins Katapult Holdings Board
feed.summary: Jeffrey Rubin resigned from Katapult Holdings' Board on November 25, 2025. Gregory L. Zink was appointed to the Board on November 26, 2025, bringing extensive experience from his roles at Newtek Business Services Corp and Newport LLC, and is expected to strengthen the board with his strategic advisory expertise. The most recent analyst rating on KPLT stock is a Hold with a $6.50 price target. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates KPLT as "Neutral" due to financial challenges and bearish technical indicators.

feed.title: Katapult Holdings, Inc. SEC 10-Q Report
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings, Inc. has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025, showing significant improvements in financial and operational metrics. The company reported a 22.8% increase in total revenue to $74.0 million and a reduction in net loss to $4.9 million. Growth was primarily driven by a 25.3% increase in gross originations, supported by its mobile app and direct merchant partnerships, with a focus on effective risk management for its lease portfolio.

feed.title: Katapult Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:KPLT) Q3 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings, Inc. reported strong Q3 2025 earnings, exceeding expectations with a reported EPS of $-0.93767 against an expected $-1.13. The company highlighted significant growth in applications (76% year-to-date), unique new customers (35%), and monthly active users (49%), attributing these successes to their market presence and customer loyalty. Katapult also secured a $65 million capital investment from Hawthorn Horizon Credit Fund, which will be used to restructure debt and invest in future growth opportunities, while tempering Q4 and full-year 2025 outlooks due to macroeconomic uncertainties.

feed.title: Katapult Holdings announces $65 million preferred stock investment and board changes By Investing.com
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings announced a $65 million private placement of convertible preferred stock with HHCF Series 21 Sub, LLC, a subsidiary of Hawthorn Horizon Credit Fund, LLC, to bolster its financial position. The financing addresses the company's negative free cash flow and involves significant board changes. The deal includes Series A and Series B preferred stock, with proceeds used to repay existing loans, and if fully converted, the investor would own 54.5% of Katapult’s common stock, subject to shareholder approval.

feed.title: Katapult Delivers Continued Growth in the Third Quarter
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings, Inc. reported strong third-quarter 2025 financial results, with gross originations increasing by 25.3% and revenue by 22.8%. The company also announced a significant investment from Hawthorn Horizon Credit Fund, strengthening its balance sheet and providing capital for future growth. Katapult anticipates continued growth in the fourth quarter and full year 2025, despite macroeconomic headwinds.

feed.title: Earnings call transcript: Katapult Holdings Q3 2025 sees revenue rise
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings (KPLT) reported a strong Q3 2025 with revenue up 22.8% to $74 million and gross originations up 25.3% to $64.2 million, driven by KPay growth and strategic product innovations. Despite a recent stock price decline, the company saw a premarket rise and is trading below its Fair Value according to InvestingPro. Katapult projects continued growth for Q4 2025 and full-year 2025, anticipating revenue growth of 18-20% and adjusted EBITDA between $8 and $9 million, while proactively addressing risks in the non-prime consumer market.

feed.title: Katapult Holdings, Inc. to Release Q3 2025 Financial Results and Host Conference Call on November 12, 2025
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings, Inc. announced it will release its Q3 2025 financial results on November 12, 2025, before market open, followed by a conference call and webcast at 8:00 AM ET. The company, which provides a lease-to-own platform for underserved non-prime consumers, emphasizes transparency and investor engagement through this announcement. The article also details recent insider trading activity and institutional investor movements in KPLT stock.

feed.title: Katapult to Announce Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results on November 12, 2025
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings, Inc. announced it will release its third quarter 2025 financial results before the market opens on Wednesday, November 12, 2025. The company will host a conference call and webcast to discuss these results at 8:00 AM ET on the same day. A live audio webcast will be available on the Katapult Investor Relations website.

feed.summary: Katapult Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ: KPLT) shows a critical price action for tactical trading, driven by predictive AI analysis. The analysis provides distinct trading strategies (Position, Momentum Breakout, Risk Hedging) and multi-timeframe signal analysis to guide traders.

feed.title: Katapult Holdings Secures Waiver Amid Loan Agreement Default - TipRanks
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings secured a Third Limited Waiver to its Loan and Security Agreement after failing to meet minimum origination requirements for August and September 2025. This waiver addresses the default temporarily and allows Class B Lenders to convert outstanding loan amounts into company stock, potentially impacting Katapult's financial structure. Analysts currently rate KPLT as a Hold with a $14.50 price target.

feed.title: Katapult Holdings enters third limited waiver on loan agreement defaults By Investing.com - Investing.com South Africa
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings has entered into its third limited waiver regarding defaults on its loan agreement. This indicates ongoing financial challenges or difficulties in meeting the terms of its existing debt obligations.

feed.title: Katapult Holdings enters third limited waiver on loan agreement defaults By Investing.com - Investing.com UK
feed.summary: This article reports that Katapult Holdings has entered into a third limited waiver regarding defaults on its loan agreement. Unfortunately, the full content of the article is not available due to an application error on the website.

feed.title: Katapult Holdings enters third limited waiver on loan agreement defaults - Investing.com
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings (NASDAQ:KPLT) has entered into a third limited waiver for its loan agreement due to failing minimum origination targets for August and September 2025, with the waiver valid until October 20, 2025. This default allows Class B lenders to convert their outstanding term loan into company common stock. Despite these financial challenges, the company reported strong Q2 2025 performance, leading Stephens to raise its price target.

feed.title: Katapult to Participate in H.C. Wainwright 27th Annual Global Investment Conference
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings, an e-commerce focused financial technology company, announced its participation in the H.C. Wainwright 27th Annual Global Investment Conference. CEO Orlando Zayas and CFO Nancy Walsh will attend, with Zayas delivering a presentation on Katapult's business, which will be available via webcast starting September 5, 2025.

feed.title: E-commerce Fintech Katapult Leadership to Present at H.C. Wainwright Global Investment Conference 2025
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings (NASDAQ: KPLT), an e-commerce focused fintech company, announced that its CEO, Orlando Zayas, and CFO, Nancy Walsh, will participate in the H.C. Wainwright 27th Annual Global Investment Conference from September 8-10, 2025. Zayas will deliver a business overview presentation, which will also be available as an on-demand webcast starting September 5, 2025. The presentation aims to provide insights into Katapult's business operations and strategy.

feed.title: Katapult Holdings Inc (KPLT) Q1 2025: Everything You Need To Know Ahead Of Earnings
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings Inc (NASDAQ:KPLT) is scheduled to release its Q1 2025 earnings on May 15, 2025, with revenue projected at $71.80 million and earnings at -$1.11 per share. Revenue estimates for full-year 2025 and 2026 have increased, while earnings estimates have seen mixed adjustments. The average target price from analysts is $11.50, suggesting a 64.99% upside, and the company currently holds a "Hold" recommendation.

feed.title: Katapult Holdings Inc. (KPLT) reports earnings
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings Inc. (KPLT) reported increased total revenue of $247.2 million for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2024, an improvement from $221.6 million the previous year. Despite a net loss of $25.9 million, which is better than the prior year's $36.7 million loss, the company faces liquidity challenges due to impending debt maturities requiring refinancing. Katapult is focusing on its lease-to-own platform for non-prime consumers and has addressed internal control weaknesses.

feed.title: Katapult Provides Update on Fourth Quarter Performance – Gross Originations Grow Double-Digits Year-Over-Year
feed.summary: Katapult announced strong fourth-quarter 2024 performance with gross originations increasing by 11.3% year-over-year to $75.2 million, exceeding company outlook. This growth was driven by a 50% increase in total lease application volume and strong engagement from repeat customers, accounting for 61.5% of originations. The company also saw significant growth from Katapult Pay®, contributing to its second-highest gross originations volume in history.

feed.title: RedPocket Mobile Chooses Katapult’s Innovative Solution as its Exclusive Lease-to-Own Option
feed.summary: RedPocket Mobile has partnered with Katapult to offer its lease-to-own (LTO) solution as an exclusive payment option, aiming to provide nonprime consumers with access to high-quality mobile devices. This collaboration seeks to financially empower underserved individuals by offering a transparent alternative to traditional financing, with no surprise fees or long-term obligations. The partnership is expected to expand RedPocket Mobile's customer base and increase sales by making essential mobile technology more accessible.

feed.title: Katapult to Participate in H.C. Wainwright 26th Annual Global Investment Conference
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ: KPLT) announced its participation in the H.C. Wainwright 26th Annual Global Investment Conference from September 9-11, 2024. CEO Orlando Zayas and CFO Nancy Walsh will represent the company, with Zayas delivering a business overview presentation. The presentation will be available virtually on-demand starting at 7:00 AM ET on September 9, 2024, accessible via Katapult's Investor Relations website.

feed.title: Katapult Promotes Derek Medlin to President and Chief Growth Officer
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ: KPLT) announced the promotion of Derek Medlin to President and Chief Growth Officer. In his new role, Medlin will lead business development, marketing, and operations, focusing on accelerating gross originations and revenue growth. He previously served as COO, where he played a key role in expanding gross originations and revenue for the e-commerce focused financial technology company.

feed.title: Meineke Selects Katapult’s Innovative Lease-to-Own Solution
feed.summary: Meineke has partnered with Katapult to offer its lease-to-own (LTO) solution to customers through Meineke Payment Solutions. This partnership aims to provide a transparent payment option for non-prime consumers for essential automotive products, expanding Meineke's customer base and offering flexible payment plans for durable goods. The collaboration also includes FormPiper for streamlined application processes and utilizes Katapult's new text-to-checkout technology for in-store transactions.

feed.title: PayTomorrow Integrates Katapult into Its Waterfall Application Process
feed.summary: PayTomorrow has integrated Katapult's lease-to-own (LTO) option into its waterfall financing platform, offering consumers greater flexibility and choice for purchasing durable goods. This partnership expands access to Katapult's LTO solution for merchants on PayTomorrow's platform, helping them reach underserved nonprime consumers and drive incremental sales. Both companies aim to democratize access to financial solutions for consumers who may not qualify for traditional financing.

feed.title: Katapult Completes Business Combination with FinServ
feed.summary: Katapult Holdings, Inc. and FinServ Acquisition Corp. have completed their business combination, forming Katapult Holdings, Inc., which will trade on Nasdaq under the ticker KPLT. The combined company's management team will continue to execute its growth strategy, and Katapult will announce its first-quarter 2021 financial results on June 15, 2021.
